org.openimaj.image.model

Interface ImageClassificationModel<T extends Image<?,T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of image that the model can be applied to
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, EstimatableModel<T,FImage>, Model<T,FImage>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HistogramPatchModel, HistogramPixelModel, MBFPatchClassificationModel, MBFPixelClassificationModel, OrthotopePixelModel, PatchClassificationModel, PixelClassificationModel, SingleGaussianPixelModel

    public interface ImageClassificationModel<T extends Image<?,T>>
extends EstimatableModel<T,FImage>, Serializable
    An ImageClassificationModel is a EstimatableModel constructed between an generic image and a probability map in the form of an FImage. Potential uses for such a model are for the prediction of certain classes of pixels in an image. For example, a model could be constructed that predicted skin-tones in an image based on hue and saturation values of pixels. With such a model, a colour image could be presented, and a probability map would be returned.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
